content.description: This is a mixed climb on the left side of the slab. Slab up past bolts placing cams in the runout sections. Finish at an anchor.

After failed attempts in the rain by Jon Garlough, Jay Denver nabbed the FA in the rain on this technical slab climb! Climb technical slab past four bolts with a crux after the first and fourth bolts. Finish at rap anchors.
At the Right end of the slab wall. A short cleaned streak to the right of People of the Sun. Has a silver dollar sized crimpy dish down low at the start. Slab up to the trees past horizontal breaks.

The first bolted line you come to. Slab up past three bolts. Crux at the third bolt. Sling trees for further protection or run it out to the tree at the top. [Its also worth noting that originally the line had only the first 2 bolts, but after taking a good size sideways fall ripping out jon's green alien and slamming into a small ledge feature we thought another bolt would probably bea good idea.]

Climb up the center of the slab wall placing gear whenever possible. This is a bold and scary climb due to questionable gear. Climb up easier slab to the final horizontal. Plunk in as much gear as possible before pulling the crux moves over the lip to the trees.
Climb the Left Arete route to the horizontal below the crux face at the top. Move left around the corner and pull up past a small flake and top out to the right of the Hole in the Roof anchors.
content.protection: Normal rack w/#2 or 3 cam for the top.
content.location: This is an easier finish to Left Arete. Rappel from trees or walk off.

content.description: As far left as you can get on the slab wall. Climb up just right of the arete placing gear in horizontals to the top. Crux at the top pulling the lip to the trees.

A girdle of the slab. Something to try after doing everything else. Start by clipping the first two bolts on People of the Sun then move left and clip the third bolt on Stolen. Continue left to the fourth bolt on Hellraiser and continue to a high clip on Joyride then its all gear. Trend down a little after Joyride as you go across the wall. At the left end turn the corner and go to the Hole in the Roof anchors and top out.
content.protection: Five bolts lead to necessary trad. A full set of cams up to #4 should keep you happy.
content.location: Start at People of the Sun and top out or lower off (if you have enough rope left) at the anchors on Hole in the Roof

content.description: This route was probably a trad route at some time. It has been bolted due to questionable gear in the cracks (can still be done on trad for a rush!)Climb up horizontal cracks with opportunity for good finger sized cams, or run it out to the first bolt. Follow 5.6-7 climbing to the forth bolt. Pull the final crux mantle move (5.8+) to the chain anchors.

Start at the climb with the tree beside it[good reference point]Climb up steep slab past 3 bolts. At the forth bolt climb up the crux headwall .Clip the fifth bolt and Make a couple interesting moves to the anchor near the large hemlock tree.
Climb up horizontal cracks that will accept cams if you wish. Climb past five bolt to rap anchors. Bolts were placed due to some crumbly rock at the top.
content.protection: Cams?, [see comment, below] 5 bolts to Rap Anchors

content.description: Dirty start, but good climbing above.
content.protection: Small gear that is pretty good, then it's runout at the top. Before climbing it, hang an 8ft sling off of the tree at the top to clip in to for the anchor.
content.location: This starts to the right of the left arete route. There's a tree about 20ft up to sling. Locate huge tree at the top about 15ft right of where Left Arete tops out. This finishes at the smaller tree to the left of the big one. It's a plumb line below that.

pathTokens: New Durham Area  (Longstack, Devil's Den, Rines Hill, etc.)

content.description: This is the first cliff you come to and one of the more popular spots. It's about 70 feet tall and has some greet sport routes on it.
